member.name: T:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.ASPApplicationValueLayoutRenderer
member.summary: ASP Application variable.

member.name: M:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.ASPApplicationValueLayoutRenderer.GetEstimatedBufferSize(NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Returns the estimated number of characters that are needed to hold the rendered value for the specified logging event.
member.remarks: Because ASP target uses COM Interop which is quite expensive, this method always returns 64.

member.name: M:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.ASPApplicationValueLayoutRenderer.Append(System.Text.StringBuilder,NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Renders the specified ASP Application variable and appends it to the specified .
member.param: The to append the rendered data to.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.ASPApplicationValueLayoutRenderer.Variable
member.summary: The variable name.

member.summary: A value from the Registry.

member.summary: Returns the estimated number of characters that are needed to hold the rendered value for the specified logging event.

member.name: M:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.RegistryLayoutRenderer.Append(System.Text.StringBuilder,NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Reads the specified registry key and value and appends it to the passed .
member.param: The to append the rendered data to.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.RegistryLayoutRenderer.Value
member.summary: Registry value.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.RegistryLayoutRenderer.DefaultValue
member.summary: The value to be output when the specified registry key or value is not found.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.LayoutRenderers.RegistryLayoutRenderer.Key
member.summary: Registry key.
member.remarks:
Must have one of the forms:
HKLM\Key\Full\Name
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Key\Full\Name
HKCU\Key\Full\Name
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Key\Full\Name

member.summary: Add <!-- --> comments around all written texts.

member.name: T:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget
member.summary: Writes log message to the specified message queue handled by MSMQ.

example.p: To set up the target in the configuration file, use the following syntax:
You can use a single target to write to multiple queues (similar to writing to multiple files with the File target).
The above examples assume just one target and a single rule. More configuration options are described here.
To set up the log target programmatically use code like this:

member.name: M:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.NeedsStackTrace
member.summary: Determines whether stack trace information should be gathered during log event processing. It calls on Layout, Queue and Label parameters.
member.returns:
0 - don't include stack trace
1 - include stack trace without source file information
2 - include full stack trace

member.name: M:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.Append(NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Writes the specified logging event to a queue specified in the Queue parameter.

member.name: M:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.PrepareMessage(NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary: Prepares a message to be sent to the message queue.
member.param: The log event to be used when calculating label and text to be written.
member.remarks: You may override this method in inheriting classes to provide services like encryption or message authentication.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.Queue
member.summary: Name of the queue to write to.
member.remarks: To write to a private queue on a local machine use .\private$\QueueName. For other available queue names, consult MSMQ documentation.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.Label
member.summary: The label to associate with each message.
member.remarks: By default no label is associated.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.CreateQueueIfNotExists
member.summary: Create the queue if it doesn't exists.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.Encoding
member.summary: Encoding to be used when writing text to the queue.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.UseXmlEncoding
member.summary: Use the XML format when serializing message.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.MSMQTarget.Recoverable
member.summary: Use recoverable messages (with guaranteed delivery).

member.summary: Outputs logging messages through the OutputDebugString() Win32 API.

member.summary: Outputs the rendered logging event through the OutputDebugString() Win32 API.

member.summary: Stub for OutputDebugString native method

member.name: T:NLog.Win32.Targets.EventLogTarget
member.summary: Writes log message to the Event Log.

example.p: To set up the target in the configuration file, use the following syntax:
This assumes just one target and a single rule. More configuration options are described here.
To set up the log target programmatically use code like this:

member.remarks: Currently there's no way to pass EventID or Category event log parameters. This issue may be addressed in future releases.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of and

member.summary: Writes the specified logging event to the event log.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.EventLogTarget.MachineName
member.summary: Machine name on which Event Log service is running.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.EventLogTarget.Source
member.summary: The value to be used as the event Source.
member.remarks: By default this is the friendly name of the current AppDomain.

member.name: P:NLog.Win32.Targets.EventLogTarget.Log
member.summary: Name of the Event Log to write to. This can be System, Application or any user-defined name.
